description.en: Main concepts related to new religious movements will be explained. An introduction to the new religious movements active in Estonia will be offered as well as an analysis of relevant problems and topics, such as causes for their emergence and spread as well as their relationship with the wider society and media.
description.et: Kursuses tutvustatakse uususunditega seotud mõisteid, Eestis tegutsevaid uususundeid ja nendega seotud probleeme ja teemasid nagu tekke ja leviku põhjused, uususundite kajastamine meedias ning nende suhted ühiskonnaga.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to introduce research on new religious movements, to explain the most commonly used concepts and talk about themes and problems related to the new religious movements.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärk on anda ülevaade uususundite uurimise ajaloost, teadusdistsipliinis käibel olevatest olulisematest mõistetest ning uususunditega seotud teemadest ja probleemidest.

learning_outcomes.en: After the completion of the course the student:
- is familiar with different new religious movements as well as with topics and problems related to them,
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb erinevaid uususundeid ning nendega seotud probleeme ja teemasid,

learning_outcomes.en: - knows how to use the relevant academic vocabulary,
- has gained initial experience and competence in fieldwork.
learning_outcomes.et: - omandab esmase välitöötegemise kogemuse ja oskuse.

resources.mandatory_materials:
Kohustuslik kirjandus
1) Üha enam erinevaid võimalusi usuturul. Ringo Ringvee ja Kaarel Kuurmaa intervjuu uususundite uurija emeriitprofessor Eilen Barkeriga. Eesti Päevaleht (23.08.2007)  https://ekspress.delfi.ee/artikkel/69129535/uha-enam-erinevaid-voimalusi-usuturul (lugeda 1. loenguks)
2) Peter Clarke (2006). Chapter I. New Religious Movements (NRMs). - New Religions in Global Perspective. Routledge, lk 19-37 (1. SEMINARI (27.09) tekst)
3) Rodney Stark (1996). Why Religious Movements Succeed or Fail: A Revised General Model. - Journal of Contemporary Religion, 11:2, 133-146 (1. SEMINARI (27.09) tekst)
4) Sean McCloud (2007). From Exotics to Brainwashers: Portraying New Religions in Mass Media (2. SEMINARI (08.11) tekst)
5) Tõnno Jonuks, Atko Remmel (2020). Metsarahva kujunemine. Retrospektiivne vaade müüdiloomele. Keel ja Kirjandus, 6, 459-482 (3. SEMINARI (22.11) tekst)
6) Ergo-Hart Västrik (2015). In Search of Genuine Religion: The Contemporary Estonian Maausulised Movement and National Discourse. In: Rountree, Kathryn (Ed.). Contemporary Pagan and Native Faith Movements in Europe: Colonialist and Nationalist Impulses (130-153). Oxford: Berghahn (3. SEMINARI (22.11) tekst

Kirjandus on kättesaadav Moodle's.
resources.recommended_materials:
Soovituslik kirjandus:
1) Christopher Partridge (ed.) (2006). Encyclopedia of New Religions: New Religious Movements, Sects and Alternative Spiritualities, Lion Hudson Plc, 2006 
2) Jean-François Mayer (2004). New Approaches to the Study of New Religions in North America and Europe. - Peter Antes et al. (eds.). New Approaches to the Study of Religion, vol 1. Walter de Gruyter, pp 407-436 
3) Peter Clarke (2005). Encyclopedia of New Religious Movements. Routledge
4) Peter Clarke (2006). New Religions in Global Perspective. Routledge
5) James. R. Lewis (ed.) (2004). The Oxford handbook of new religious movements. Oxford University Press
6) Lorne L. Dawson (2003). Cults and New Religious Movements. Blackwell Publishers
7) Elisabeth Arweck (2006). Researching New Religious Movements. Routledge
